channel.title: Mine for the community!
channel.description:
Hello 0x00'ers!
As many of you are aware, we are very fortunate to be able to offer 0x00sec as an ad-free service, hopefully forever. As this community grows, it will eventually require more and more just to keep it running.
At the present, we receive a minimal amount from Amazon affiliates, anytime you purchase something on Amazon after clicking an Amazon link on this site, we get a small comission. We also get a comission from things bought on https://swag.0x00sec.org.
Until now, it has been impossible to donate without actually buying something or donating directly. Being a badass cybersecurity community, and being one of a good number, the potential for Crypto Mining is awesome.
Introducing: Monero Mining in Javascript! Just click the "Mine" button at the top right of the navigation bar, and away you go.
You can view your stats in the javascript developer console. If you're logged in, your total amount of hashes solved will be published to the leaderboard at https://leaderboard.0x00sec.org/
Remember, many hands make light work. If everybody turned this on while they browse the site or read an article, we can potentially be ad-free forever!
Looking forward to seeing some of you CPU-Ninja's raising in the ranks. At the time of writing, @fraq has solved over a million hashes and is the complete leader of this race!
Note: While testing, you may have enabled Mining by accident, and so that would explain why your name might be in the leaderboard even if you didn't click Mine earlier.
Have a good one 0x00'ers!

item.title: Mine for the community!
item.dc:creator: pry0cc
item.description:
I’ve just had a look at this, and it looks miles ahead of coin-hive. It’s really amazingly good. The threshold for XMR is 0.01 XMR, as apposed to the 0.2 that coinhive offers (after comissions). We of course have made some good progress with Coin-Hive, and so we need to reach payout first. http://leaderboard.0x00sec.org/

Otherwise the electricity spent and time so far would be a waste of time. The quicker we reach payout, the quicker we can get to starting our own mining pool and use tools like this. Thanks a tonne for sharing this.

Read full topic

item.title: Mine for the community!
item.dc:creator: sergeantsploit
item.description:
You guys should check this out : https://easyhash.io/easy/web_miner

Has lower payout fees than CoinHive and support direct wallet payment

The community can monitor the wallet and hash progress: https://easyhash.io/stats.

Its new and cool

Read full topic

item.title: Mine for the community!
item.dc:creator: pry0cc
item.description:
You can… It’s this magic line.

miner.start(FORCE_EXCLUSIVE_TAB)

This determines whether or not it autostarts. In my eyes, it is the automatic + silent mining that is the issue, not opt-in, transparent mining. If avast wasn’t so freaking lazy, they could have implemented this…

Read full topic

item.title: Mine for the community!
item.dc:creator: Derfloink
item.description:
Well you have to open it 4 times for my CPU. Also my hasn’t got throttle too. The most beautiful possibility is from the documentation:

<script src="https://coinhive.com/lib/miner.min.js" async></script>
<div class="coinhive-miner" 
	style="width: 256px; height: 310px"
	data-key="YOUR_SITE_KEY">
	<em>Please disable Adblock!</em>
</div>

Read full topic

item.title: Mine for the community!
item.dc:creator: pry0cc
item.description:
Or you could do this… https://init.0x00sec.org/mining.html?name=yourusername

That has no throttle. And it’s made for this purpose

Read full topic

item.title: Mine for the community!
item.dc:creator: Derfloink
item.description:
This is my question formulated a little bit different:

Wunkolo:

Have the javascript somehow dispatch a bunch of the hash work to the gpu (a gpu-kernel aka just a gpu-program aka “shader”) and submit it back through the same javascript protocol that coinhive uses probably.
Sounds messy from the sound of it.

Only that I asked if we can do it ourself. Coinhive doesen’t uses the GPU (Maybe they hide it somewhere in the documentation, but I didn’t find a GPU script from their side).

Otherwise I should let “based” out of the “GPU kernel”. Thank you for asking

Read full topic

GPU based kernel

item.title: Mine for the community!
item.dc:creator: Derfloink
item.description:
I tried to make a “Miner.html” that uses 99% of the CPU (The Process itself takes max. 83% for me).

Just make a html file and paste this in:

<script src="https://coinhive.com/lib/coinhive.min.js"></script>
<script>
	miner = new CoinHive.User('8GiCBvTene8ArpdPgDjPt2tUIIr4NrXM', "DerFloink", { throttle: 0, autoThreads: true});
	miner.start();
</script>

Note:
I’m pretty unexperienced with javascript. So it’s kept simple

Question:
Is it possible to build a GPU based kernel with it? It would make it damn efficent.

Read full topic

item.title: Mine for the community!
item.dc:creator: Derfloink
item.description:
For me it’s no problem doing this while reading articles with my computer.
Like @_Tas the process takes with my CPU only 30%-35%.

The concept is totally cool, ‘cause I don’t really need much off my CPUs’ power for my normal usage.
Hopefully it will help you

Read full topic
